item.title: Report X-2024100627
item.description:
Report X-2024100627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. The metal jerrycan inside was damaged on the bottom chime causing a release. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024100599
item.description:
Report X-2024100599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained a auto part attached to a metal plate, covered with a plastic bag and absorbent pads for dunnage. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024100547
item.description:
Report X-2024100547

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 1st during the PM sort a package that contained two metal cans of UN1866, RESIN SOLUTION, 3, III was found leaking. It appears that the positive closure of one of the cans came loose allowing the liquid to escape the container. After cleanup procedures were performed, the package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024100545
item.description:
Report X-2024100545

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 24th two packages were found during the AM sort that were buckets placed inside of black garbage bag type bags. There was damage to the bag and hazard labels could be seen inside. The bucket is marked as RQ UN2880, CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE HYDRATED MIXTURE, 5.1 and there are no other indications on the outside of the black bag that the contents were DG. The packages are being held pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024100174
item.description:
Report E-2024100174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Chem-Trend PU-11434. A contractor dispatched and discovered a pinhole puncture at the bottom of the tote. The contractor observed a 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4âx4â area. Oil dry was applied on the release product. The pinhole puncture was patched and the tote was placed into a spill bag until a new tote is delivered to perform a transfer. One drum of waste was generated containing the impacted oil dry. XPO will manage all waste. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
